qas.question: What is the common name for New York's high technology sector?
Who created the Global Economic Power Index that ranked New York first?
In what year did the Port of New York and New Jersey deal with unprecedented cargo volume?
In what year was New York ranked first on the Global Economic Power Index?

context: New York is a global hub of international business and commerce. In <a3_0>2012<a3_0/>, New York City topped the first Global Economic Power Index, published by <a1_0>The Atlantic<a1_0/> (to be differentiated from a namesake list published by the Martin Prosperity Institute), with cities ranked according to criteria reflecting their presence on similar lists as published by other entities. The city is a major center for banking and finance, retailing, world trade, transportation, tourism, real estate, new media as well as traditional media, advertising, legal services, accountancy, insurance, theater, fashion, and the arts in the United States; while <a0_0>Silicon Alley<a0_0/>, metonymous for New York's broad-spectrum high technology sphere, continues to expand. The Port of New York and New Jersey is also a major economic engine, handling record cargo volume in the first half of <a2_0>2014<a2_0/>.
